results.title: The New Zealanders
results.brief_description: Life in New Zealand. Countryside, cities and typical homes; transport; the Maoris; parliament; schools; child care; free health and educational services; agriculture as the mainstay of the economy; the state of secondary industry; hydro-electric and geothermal power; maintaining standards in primary products for export; the arts, sports and recreations; thermal regions; a Maori pah.

results.title: The New Zealand school dental service
results.brief_description: Training of school dental nurses at the main dental clinic, Wellington, and work of the young nurses in the primary schools. Shows features of this service which is unique in the world.

results.title: The New traders
results.creator_credit: Sydney Latter, Gerard Holdsworth, Unilever Films and United Africa Company
results.brief_description: In town and village modern merchandising is changing the habits, customs and outlook of the peoples of Nigeria and Ghana. The African retailer is adapting his old trading skills learned in the traditional market stalls, and applying up-to-date techniques. Shows something of the way in which the United Africa Company is contributing to the part these new traders are now playing.

results.title: The New tax system : 'How to' series
results.brief_description: This video contains the four videos in the “How to” series that have been produced by the Australian Taxation Office to assist with the implementation of the new Goods and Services Tax. It contains information about who should register and how too register for an ABN, the new Business Activity Statement, the requirements and importance of good record keeping and the Pay As You Go system. Presented by Michael Caton.

results.title: The New stone age
results.brief_description: Shows a Stone Age village in the Orkneys which was recovered from the sand dunes. Features houses, furniture and effects telling of the life and customs of Stone Age people. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The New rangers
results.creator_credit: David Roberts, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Looks at the new breed of rangers being trained at Kakadu National Park. The training program is for Aboriginals whose families have been the traditional owners of the area. The aim is that Kakadu will be managed and run by the Aboriginal people, who will pass on a little of their culture to the visitors who come to see the park.

results.title: The New pattern
results.creator_credit: Fred Lasse, Stanley Hawes and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: This account of Labor-Management Production Committees in the construction industry in wartime Britain takes as an example the building of an airfield, and shows some of the problems involved in a construction job of this kind. The film also demonstrates the methods of election of the men’s representatives on the Committee, the discussion and decisions of the Committee and how the Committee acts as a channel for suggestions by the men for improving production efficiency. As a result relations between management and men are good, everyone works together to get on with the job, and the speed of construction is accelerated.

results.title: The New order
results.creator_credit: Curtis Levy, Christine Olsen, Olsen Levy and Zex AFFC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Riding the tiger”.
Riding the Tiger Series. In this episode we trace the struggle between the military, the communists and the rich landed Muslim gentry to control the economy of the newly-formed nation. In 1965 the tensions between the various factions exploded: President Sukarno was replaced by military general Suharto and half a million communists and “communist sympathisers” were executed. Since 1965 the military has developed a one-party dictatorship which actively encourages its civilians to allow the dictates of business (both local and foreign) to take precedence over all other aspects of life. The last part of the video examines the conflict between Indonesia’s economic growth and its governments’ consistent human rights abuses.

results.title: The New mine
results.brief_description: A study of a modern colliery at Comrie, in Scotland. Comrie is a challenge to coalmine owners. It has been fully mechanised with the most modern coal-hewing and safety equipment; ventilation throughout the mine is constant and controlled, and every amenity and safety measure to help the men who work underground is in use. In addition, the surface works are well planned, so that slagheaps and railway-yards do not deface the countryside.
